content:
• Thursday, December 7, 2017
  • ALXN

    Alexion +2.6% on report Elliott has taken activist stake

    • Activist Elliott Management has turned its sights on Alexion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXN), taking a stake in the biopharma and pushing for ways to lift its share price, The New York Times reports.
    • That means a proxy fight could be ahead if there's inaction, sources told the paper.
    • Alexion shares are up 2.6% after hours.
    • Alexion, worth just shy of $24B at today's close, has been working to recover from problems under previous management. Much of the senior team has been replaced since Ludwig Hantson took over in March, and the company this fall announced plans to lay of 20% of its workforce and invest in new treatments.
    • The deadline for nominating directors comes at the end of the month.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 PM | 5 Comments
  • MNOV

    MediciNova +52% on positive trial results for MN-166 in ALS

    • MediciNova (NASDAQ:MNOV) +52.7% after-hours on news it received positive top-line results from its clinical trial of MN-166 (ibudilast) drug in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
    • MNOV says the trial achieved the primary endpoint of safety and tolerability, and demonstrated efficacy trends in favor of MN-166.
    • MNOV says it is attempting to develop MN-166 for progressive multiple sclerosis and other neurological conditions such as ALS.
    • The drug has been marketed in Japan and South Korea to treat post-stroke complications and bronchial asthma.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM | 7 Comments
  • DTEA

    David's Tea evaluating options, including potential sale

    • David's Tea (NASDAQ:DTEA) +2.5% after-hours, as the Canadian tea seller says it is exploring strategic alternatives including a potential sale of the company, just two years after going public.
    • The company says it is considering include selling assets and seeking joint venture partners as well as putting itself up for sale.
    • DTEA made its announcement while reporting weaker than expected Q3 earnings, as same-store sales fell 6.8% Y/Y, reflecting challenges in accessories and kits that “did not excite the customer.”
     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson parent American Outdoor -14% after cutting EPS outlook

    • American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOBC) -14.4% after-hours in the wake of sharp Y/Y declines in FQ2 earnings and revenues, as the Smith & Wesson parent company also warns of continued difficulties.
    • Adjusted earnings for the quarter came in at a better than expected $0.11/share but still were far short of the $0.68 in the year-ago period, and sales of $148.4M were more than a third lower than last year's $233.5M.
    • AOBC sees FQ3 adjusted EPS of $0.07-$0.10 on revenues of $170M-$180M, and full-year EPS of $0.57-$0.67 on sales of $650M-$675M, well below analyst expectations of $0.41 EPS on sales of $209M for the current quarter and $1.09 EPS on $711M in sales for the full year; the company previously had forecast full-year EPS of $1.04-$1.24 on sales of $700M-$740M.
    • On Q2, CEO James Debney says "Lower shipments in our firearms business reflected a significant reduction in wholesaler and retailer orders vs. the prior year," adding that strong firearm sales in the year-ago quarter were "driven by personal safety concerns and pre-election fears of increased firearm legislation."
     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM | 21 Comments
  • TELL

    Tellurian to launch 8M-share offering

    • Tellurian (NASDAQ:TELL) -11.7% after-hours as it announces a public offering of 8M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.2M shares.
    • TELL says it plans to use the proceeds from the offering for detailed engineering of a liquefied natural gas terminal facility and an associated pipeline in Louisiana, plus general corporate purposes and working capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: CLDR +5.5%. DCIX +4.3%. OCSL +4.3%. VSTM +4.0%. FNSR +4.0%.
    • Top losers: AOBC -13.6%. BGNE -2.6%. COO -2.2%. XENT -2.2%. NVRO -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • DEA

    Easterly REIT, Cutera bounce on additions to SmallCap 600

    • Government-focused REIT Easterly Government Properties (NYSE:DEA) is up 4.8% after hours on word it's moving into the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • The company's replacing PharMerica (NYSE:PMC) in that index after the latter's acquisition by KKR closed today. The move's effective prior to Tuesday's open.
    • Also joining the 600 is laser maker Cutera (NASDAQ:CUTR), up 2% after hours. Effective prior to the open on Friday, Dec. 15, Cutera will replace Tesco (NASDAQ:TESO), which is being acquired by Nabors Industries.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • OLED

    Universal Display announces OLED agreement with BOE Technology

    • Universal Display Corporation (NASDAQ:OLED) enters into a long-term, multi-year agreement with BOE Technology Group for supplying phosphorescent OLED materials to use in BOE’s products.
    • Financial terms not disclosed. 
    • Universal Display shares are up 0.9% aftermarket.           
    • Previously: Universal Display up after Q3 beats, upside FY17 guidance (Nov. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • CLDR

    Cloudera +4.8% after Q3 beats, upside guidance

    • Cloudera (NYSE:CLDR) shares are up 4.8% after reporting Q3 results that beat revenue and EPS estimates. Q4 guidance has revenue from $97M to $99M (consensus: $97.31M) and EPS from -$0.24 to -$0.22 (consensus: -$0.26).  
    • FY18 guidance: revenue, $361M to $363M (consensus: $358.67M); EPS, -$0.84 to -$0.82 (consensus: -$0.93).
    • Key metrics: Subscription revenue, $78.1M (+48% Y/Y); subscription gross margin, 86%; operating cash flow, -$2.4M; operating expenses, $118M; cash and equivalents, $484M; Global 8000 customer net add, 23. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Cloudera beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 12 Comments
  • ENZ

    Enzo Biochem fiscal Q1 top line up 5%; shares down 2% after hours

    • Enzo Biochem (NYSE:ENZ) fiscal Q1 results ($M): Revenues: 27.7 (+5.3%); Lab Services: 20.3 (+9.1%).
    • Net Loss: (0.6) (+56.6%); Loss/share: (0.01) (+66.7%).
    • NY State Health Department approved final three molecular diagnostic tests in 13-analyte women's health panel.
    • Shares are down 2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • FNSR

    Finisar gains with Q2 revenue decline smaller than expected

    • Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) is up 3.1% after hours on heavy postmarket volume after fiscal Q2 earnings where profits fell short, and revenues declined but beat Street consensus.
    • The company saw strong demand for its 100G transceivers for data centers, says CEO Jerry Rawls, but revenues fell 2.8% sequentially (and more than 10% Y/Y) "primarily due to lower revenues from our Chinese OEM customers."
    • Sales of datacom products fell by $1.7M (down 0.7% Q/Q) amid lower demand for 10G-and-below transceivers, 40G QSFP transceivers, and 100G CFP Ethernet transceivers.
    • Telecom products, meanwhile, declined 9.5% Q/Q ($7.9M) on lower Chinese OEM demand.
    • Margins declined sequentially across the board: Non-GAAP gross margin fell to 30.3% from 34.9%, and operating margin dropped to 7.8% from 13.5%.
    • For Q3, it's guiding to revenues of $325M-$345M (vs. consensus for $344M), gross margin (non-GAAP) of 30-31%, operating margin of 7.5-8.5%, and EPS of $0.21-$0.27 (below $0.33 consensus).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • FENC

    Fennec readies equity offering

    • Fennec Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:FENC) launches a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras promises to revise LPG pricing policy after spike

    • Petrobras (PBR -2.8%) says it will review its pricing policy for liquefied petroleum gas, following a 70% price spike since June for the fuel which is widely used by Brazilians for cooking.
    • The state-controlled company says it will review the policy, which currently follows international prices, since “reference markets in Europe have been highly volatile because of winter.”
    • PBR says the 8.9% price rise announced this week was the last under the current scheme.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • HCLP

    Hi-Crush Partners started with Buy rating at B. Riley FBR

    • Hi-Crush Partners (HCLP +1.2%) is higher after B. Riley FBR initiates coverage of the stock with a Buy rating and a $16 price target.
    • HCLP is "well positioned to grow distributions over the coming years due to high-return growth projects in both sand mining and logistics, complementing what we believe is already an attractive combination of low-cost mining and infrastructure assets," the firm writes.
    • B. Riley FBR also starts U.S. Silica (SLCA +2%) at Buy, and Emerge Energy Services (EMES -5.8%) and Fairmount Santrol (FMSA +3.4%) with Neutral ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 46 Comments
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm and Baidu announce AI, IoT collaboration

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) and Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) announce a strategic collaboration to optimize Baidu’s DuerOS for Qualcomm’s Snapdragon Mobile Platform including the newly announced Snapdragon 845.
    • DuerOS is a conversational artificial intelligence system for smartphones. Combined with Qualcomm’s Aqstic hardware and software, the companies can support a complete AI voice and smart assistant solution for smartphones and IoT devices.
    • Baidu shares are up 1.5%.        
    • Previously: Qualcomm reveals Snapdragon 845 detail (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 9 Comments
  • FIZZ

    National Beverage beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • National Beverage (NASDAQ:FIZZ): Q2 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $244.12M (+20.1% Y/Y) beats by $5.09M.
    • Shares +4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 7 Comments
  • SCMP

    Sucampo mulling acquisition offer; shares up 5%

    • Bloomberg reports that Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (SCMP +4.7%) has received takeover interest. Management is apparently considering its options which may include making acquisitions itself.
    • Shares have rallied almost 50% since late November.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 1 Comment

  • AMCX

    Positive talk from Cooperman on AMC

    • Leon Cooperman pitched AMC Networks (AMCX +1.5%) as a long pick during an interview with CNBC. He called shares undervalued at their current level.
    • Cooperman's Omega Advisors took a stake in AMC in Q1 and reported a 5.84% passive position as of November 3.
    • AMC trades on the low end of its 52-week range of $10.80 to $35.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • IPHI

    Rosenblatt downgrades Inphi

    • Rosenblatt downgrades Inphi (NYSE:IPHI) from Neutral to Buy.
    • Latest analyst recommendations (via FT): 5 Buy, 6 Outperform, and 2 Hold.
    • Median price target: $46. 
    • Inphi shares are down 3.9%.
    • Previously: Inphi reports Q3 beats, in-line guidance (Oct. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • SCWX

    JPMorgan downgrades SecureWorks

    • JPMorgan downgrades SecureWorks (NASDAQ:SCWX) from Neutral to Overweight and lowers the price target to $12 from $15.
    • Analyst Sterling Auty notes that SecureWorks beat Q3 estimates but included downgrade guidance that Auty says could show caution after the departure of the CRO in October.
    • Auty does call SecureWorks the “best positioned” among the managed security service providers.   
    • SecureWorks shares are down 7.5%.    
    • Previously: SecureWorks reports Q3 beats, downside guidance (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • AVID

    Dougherty & Co. downgrades Avid Tech

    • Dougherty & Company downgrades Avid Tech (NASDAQ:AVID) from Neutral to Sell with a $4.50 price target.
    • Firm says Avid has shown important progress over the last few quarters in terms of bookings and expense control, but the company doesn’t see a path to sustainable top-line growth, better profitability, and material generation of FCF. 
    • The firm sees more downside than not while Avid trades at 9x EV/18 EBITDA. 
    • Avid shares are down 9.4%.    
    • Previously: Avid Technology +22.5% after mixed Q3, upside guidance (Nov. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • MEI

    Methode Electronics -8.5% after Q2 results and mixed guidance

    • Methode Electronics (NYSE:MEI) shares are down 8.2% after Q2 results beat revenue estimates and met on EPS and included mixed guidance.
    • FY18 guidance has revenue from $880M to $900M (consensus: $877.05M, was: $807M to $827M) and EPS from $2.43 to $2.63 (consensus: $2.59).
    • Press release 
    • Previously: Methode Electronics EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 3 Comments

    | 12:44 PM | 12 Comments
  • VRNT

    Vernit Systems -8.9% despite Q3 beats, in-line guidance

    • Verint Systems (NASDAQ:VRNT) shares are down 8.9% despite Q3 results beat revenue and EPS estimates.
    • FY18 guidance has revenue from $1.13B to $1.15B (consensus: $1.14B) and EPS at $2.75 (consensus: $2.76). 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Verint Systems beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 1 Comment

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: HOME +17%. GEF +15%. VNCE +10%. ROX +8%. LULU +7%.
    • Losers: HOFT -8%. BTN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel upgraded at J.P. Morgan on expectations of higher steel prices

    • AK Steel (AKS +5.3%) is higher after J.P. Morgan upgrades shares to Overweight from Neutral with a $7 price target, hiked from $6, saying the Department of Commerce's ruling against China redirecting steel to Vietnam will push steel prices higher in the U.S.
    • "The retroactive nature of the duties will make importers of record in the U.S. more reluctant to buy "cheap" imports in the future and should support higher steel prices in the U.S.," JPM analyst Michael Gambardella writes.
    • Given the outlook for higher steep prices, JPM raises its 2018 EPS estimate to $1.00 from $0.83 and says earnings should increase sequentially throughout 2018 from a base of a $0.13/share loss in Q4 2017 due to higher maintenance and input costs, lower shipments and lower prices.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • GBTC

    Bitcoin goes (more) parabolic

    • Little more than one day ago, Bitcoin had never been higher than $13K. In a continuation of frenzied action, the price hit $19.5K a few minutes ago. That's according to Google Finance. Prices are varying widely and wildly across exchanges.
    • GF is showing a current price of $18,070.
    • Major U.S. exchange Coinbase has crashed again.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 339 Comments
  • OKTA

    Okta +2.4% after Q3 beats, upside guidance

    • Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) shares are up 2.4% after Q3 results beat EPS and revenue estimates. Upside Q4 guidance has revenue from $70M to $71M (consensus: $67.86M) and EPS from -$0.18 to -$0.17 (consensus: -$0.20).
    • FY18 guidance: revenue, $252M to $253M (consensus: $244.72M); EPS, -$0.87 to -$0.86 (consensus: -$0.96).    
    • Press release   
    • Previously: Okta beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • PIRS

    Pieris on go with early-stage study of inhaled therapy for treatment-resistant asthma; shares ahead 5%

    • Pieris Pharmaceuticals (PIRS +4.6%) secures regulatory approvals to launch an Australia-based Phase 1 clinical trial assessing PRS-060/AZD1402 in patients with moderate-to-severe asthma uncontrolled with standard care. The study, in healthy volunteers, is being funded by development partner AstraZeneca (AZN +0.2%).
    • PRS-060/AZD1402 is an Anticalin antibody that it is delivered by inhalation which the company says may allow lower doses than alternative therapies while boosting efficacy and tolerability.
    • Previously: Pieris Pharma +41% on drug development deal with AstraZeneca (May 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • SIMO

    Summit Redstone upgrades Silicon Motion

    • Summit Redstone upgrades Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) from Hold to Buy.
    • Latest analyst recommendations (via FT): 2 Buy, 9 Outperform, 2 Hold, and 1 Underperform. 
    • Median price target: $57. 
    • Silicon Motion shares are up 1.1%. 
       
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • XOMA

    XOMA licenses hyperinsulinemia candidate XOMA 358 to Rezolute; shares up 10%

    • XOMA (XOMA +10%) has out-licensed product candidate XOMA 358 to Rezolute (ANTB -15%) for up to $240M.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, XOMA will receive milestone payments from Rezolute related to financing, clinical development, regulatory progress and commercial sales and high single-digit to mid-teens royalties. XOMA will also receive $5M in Rezolute common stock and an additional $13M in cash and stock when Rezolute completes certain financing milestones.
    • Rezolute is responsible for all development, regulatory, manufacturing and commercialization activities.
    • XOMA is entitled to receive low single-digit royalties on net sales of AB101 and other products developed from Rezolute's extended-release and oral plasma kallikrein inhibitor platforms.
    • XOMA 358 is a fully human antibody that inhibits the effect of elevated insulin by modulating the insulin receptor. It has Orphan Drug status in the U.S. and Europe for congenital hyperinsulinism.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • WIMHF

    William Hill jumps on sector M&A activity

    • Shares of William Hill (OTCPK:WIMHF, OTCPK:WIMHY) are up 7.58% in London trading after news broke that GVC is making a play for Ladbrokes.
    • Consolidation in the global betting sector has been widely anticipated.
    • Previously: Ladbrokes +29% with GVC Holdings circling (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • GEF

    Greif +14% to 52-week high after beating on earnings, revenue

    • Greif (GEF +14.1%) spikes to a new 52-week high after posting solid beats for FQ4 earnings and revenues despite weather related headwinds.
    • GEF says Hurricane Harvey adversely affected earnings by $5.3M, higher than initial expectations of a $2.5M adverse weather impact.
    • Q3 gross profit fell by $1M vs. the year-ago quarter to $182.4M, primarily related to adverse weather events, but operating profit rose by $6.8M to $60.4M and operating profit before special items gained $1.9M to $88.9M; free cash flow jumped $53.9M to $168.2M.
    • GEF issues in-line guidance for FY 2018, seeing EPS of $3.25-$3.55 vs. $3.40 analyst consensus estimate.
    • The company notes the end of FY 2017 concludes its three-year Transformation initiative, saying optimization activities identified during the initiative will continue into 2018 and full-year benefits of 2017 initiatives will be realized in 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • MTBC

    Medical Transcription secures $3.9M capital raise; shares off 1%

    • Medical Transcription Billing (MTBC -1.1%) has sold 155,440 shares of its non-convertible 11% Series A Cumulative Redeemable Perpetual Redeemable Preferred Stock at $25 per share yielding gross proceeds of ~$3.9M.
    • Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes. Closing date is December 11.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: SAGE +72%. ENTL +49%. VTGN +25%. MYO +19%. MRNS +16%.
    • Losers: FCSC -30%. ONS-OLD -11%. OTC:EGLT -9%. OTC:ANTH -8%. CHFS -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • LPL

    LG Display could supply OLED panels for iPhone X

    • LG Display (NYSE:LPL) responds to speculation that the company signed an agreement with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) to supply OLED panels for the iPhone X.
    • “Regarding the OLED supply deal for Apple’s iPhone X, nothing has been set in detail. When anything is confirmed in detail, we will announce it,” says LG Display.
    • Samsung is currently the only OLED supplier for the iPhone X, which has led to production delays and higher prices. Apple has worked with LG behind the scenes to ramp up its OLED production, but it had looked like LG wouldn’t have panels ready until at least 2019.
    • Now The Korean Herald suggests LG could ship up to 60M displays in June 2018.
    • LG Display shares are up 0.3%. 
    • Apple shares are up 0.60%.  
    • Previously: Apple won't have second OLED supplier until 2019 (Sept. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 82 Comments
  • SEAC

    SeaChange vaults 25% after Q3 earnings top high estimates

    • SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC) is up 24.8% and already surpassed 10 times normal daily volume after it topped high estimates with its Q3 results.
    • The company swung to a income from operations of $0.9M on a GAAP basis from a year-ago loss from operations of $8.4M.
    • Non-GAAP operating income was $0.5M vs. a year-ago loss of $18.7M.
    • “We are very pleased with our progress this past quarter, where growth from existing and new customers for IP video and cloud-based deployments translated into higher revenue and enabled us to achieve non-GAAP operating income," said CEO Ed Terino.
    • Revenue breakout: Products, $11.1M (up 197%); Services, $12.3M (down 24%).
    • It's expected Q4 revenue of $20M-$24M (vs. consensus for $22.3M) and non-GAAP operating income of $0.02-$0.10/share. For fiscal 2018, it's boosting expectations for revenue to $77M-$81M (vs. $80.3M consensus) and non-GAAP operating income of $0.04-$0.12/share.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • HRB

    H&R Block gives back yesterday's gains; BTIG reiterates bearish outlook

    • The company's strong guidance for the rest of fiscal 2018 doesn't jibe with what's becoming an even tougher do-it-yourself tax prep market, says BTIG's Mark Palmer, reiterating his Sell rating and $19 price target.
    • Palmer notes H&R Block's (NYSE:HRB) DIY segment had 3.5% volume growth in fiscal 2017, but that came mostly thanks to a 10% price cut. Now, Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) is promising to be aggressive on prices in 2018, and Credit Karma is seeing speedy uptake for its free service.
    • After a 10%-plus rise yesterday, shares are down 8.2% today to $26.61. INTU is off 0.6%.
    • Previously: H&R Block rallies on changing tax code (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM

  • EIA Natural Gas Inventory

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: +2 Bcf vs. -7 Bcf consensus, -33 Bcf last week.
    • Futures -4.72% to $2.784.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, GAZ, KOLD, UNL,DCNG.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 90 Comments
  • SNPS

    Synopsys initiates $200M accelerated share repurchase program

    • Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) enters into accelerated share repurchase agreements for $200M of stock.
    • The agreement was made with JPMorgan Chase Bank, National Association, and MUFG Securities EMEA.
    • Synopsys will receive an initial share delivery of approximately 1.8M shares and the rest, if any, will be settled no later than May 16 on the repurchase completion. 
    • Synopsys shares are up 0.72%.  
    • Previously: Needham raises its Synopsys price target (Dec. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • LC

    LendingClub outlook disappoints; shares tumble 15%

    • The company's investor day isn't going as hoped. Revenue next year is guided to $680M-$705M, with the midpoint of that shy of Street estimates for $699M.
    • Q4 revenue is now seen at $155M-$160M vs. previous $158M-$163M, with adjusted EBITDA of $16M-$20M vs. previous $19M-$23M.
    • 2018 adjusted EBITDA is seen at $75M-$90M - that's up from $42M-$46M expected this year, but at least some Street estimates were for well over $100M.
    • Presentation slides
    • Webcast
    • LC -15.2%
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 33 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple suppliers recover after Broadcom sales comments

    • Apple (AAPL +0.5%) suppliers are recovering after Broadcom (AVGO +1.8%) suggests the late launch of the iPhone X will boost sales.
    • During the earnings call, Broadcom CEO Hock Tan said the company expects Q1 wireless revenue to grow sequentially as the “ramp in demand from our North American customer this year was pushed out compared to prior years.”   
    • Suppliers on the move: Skyworks (SWKS -0.5%), Cirrus Logic (CRUS +1.6%), and Qorvo (QRVO -0.5%).         
    • Previously: Apple suppliers drop after Largan warns of lower Dec. revenue (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 33 Comments
  • CTL

    CenturyLink +2.9% after cramming probe finds mistakes but not fraud

    • CenturyLink (NYSE:CTL), up 2.9% in early going today, says it's wrapped an investigation into "cramming" that found no evidence of fraud or wrongdoing, but acknowledged failures tied to pricing, promotion and billing that ended up disappointing customers.
    • A special committee of its independent board members conducted the review after a former employee charged the company with sales misconduct, including charging customers for services they didn't order.
    • There wasn't evidence to conclude management engaged in wrongdoing, the committee said, and management didn't condone or encourage cramming that wasn't common at the company.
    • But some products were "complex and caused confusion, and the resulting bills sometimes failed to meet customer expectations," the company says, and software limitations made it difficult to clearly estimate bills for customers.
    • Also, some customers didn't receive an offered point-of-sale discount due to "systems and human errors" and those problems weren't resolved in a timely manner.

  • VALE

    Vale threatens to flood iron ore market if prices jump

    • Vale (NYSE:VALE), the world’s biggest producer of iron ore, is prepared to unleash as much as 50M metric tons of spare capacity to balance the market if prices get too high, CEO Fabio Schvartsman tells Bloomberg.
    • High prices would lure inefficient producers back into the market and risk a repeat of past excesses that led to $1T in value destruction, the CEO says.
    • As Vale shifts focus to high-grade deposits in Brazil’s Amazon region, Schvartsman expects to produce 390M tons in 2018 and cap production at 400M tons over the following four years, well below its 450M-ton capacity.

  • SAGE

    Sage Therapeutics' SAGE-217 successful in mid-stage MDD study; shares ahead 52% premarket

    • Sage Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SAGE) is up 52% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing SAGE-217 for the treatment of adult patients with moderate-to-severe major depressive disorder (MDD), a Fast Track indication in the U.S.
    • The 89-subject study met its primary endpoint of a statistically significant average reduction in HAM-D score from baseline to day 15 (p<0.0001) versus placebo. HAM-D is a rating scale for depression. At day 15, 64% of patients in the treatment group achieved remission compared to 23% for placebo (p=0.0005). Other secondary endpoints were also met.
    • SAGE-217 was generally well-tolerated with no serious or severe adverse events observed. The most common adverse events were headache, dizziness, nausea and drowsiness.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 8:00 am ET to discuss the results.
    • SAGE-217, a neuroactive steroid, is next-generation GABA modulator. The GABA system, the major inhibitory signaling pathway in the brain and central nervous system (CNS), plays a key role in regulating CNS function. The company intends to advance the program into Phase 3 development.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM | 13 Comments
